projects.name: Designing for the Third Age: Senior Co-Living in Nature
projects.studioTitle: Superdiversity, Urban Living for All - Housing in Nature
description: The new generation of elderly in Singapore is redefining health and ageing. Current care options are ill-equipped to provide for this cohort of seniors who seek independence, psychosocial health and community connectedness.
How then, might our residential project respond to broadened definitions of aged health and propose a new form of holistic health management that involves the rich local ecology of Yishun?

Weaving together a busy urban contex, forests, swampland and a peaceful waterfront. The Third Age invites nature and activity into its half-open courtyards, peeling in various direction to create open plazas to keep its residents immersed in communal activity.

Created by an aggregation of alternating units and open-air loggias, each shared house provides a mix of gathering space and private nooks, as well as ample space for expansion if the resident's health demands it. Aging-in-place, gracefully, hence becomes a reality.
